# DOJ Epstein Files Search

> AI-powered search and analysis tool for over 2,000 Department of Justice documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein case

## About

This is an open-source, free-to-use search engine that provides AI-powered summaries and direct access to official Department of Justice documents. The tool uses Groq's Llama 3.3 70B model to generate summaries and supports 6 languages (English, Dutch, French, German, Spanish, Portuguese).

## Main Pages

- Home: https://epstein-search.vercel.app/en - Main search interface with chat-based interaction
- About: https://epstein-search.vercel.app/en/about - Project mission, technology stack, and data sources
- FAQ: https://epstein-search.vercel.app/en/faq - Frequently asked questions about the tool and documents
- Timeline: https://epstein-search.vercel.app/en/timeline - Chronological overview of the case
- Key Figures: https://epstein-search.vercel.app/en/key-figures - Overview of key individuals documented in the case
- Privacy: https://epstein-search.vercel.app/en/privacy - Privacy policy and data handling

## Features

- **Fast Search**: Queries the DOJ multimedia search index and generates AI summaries
- **Deep Analysis**: Downloads full PDFs and performs comprehensive text extraction and analysis
- **Multi-language Support**: Interface available in 6 languages, AI summaries in user's selected language
- **Direct Source Links**: All document links point to official DOJ.gov sources
- **Anonymous & Free**: No tracking, no accounts required, rate-limited to prevent abuse

## API Endpoints

- `/api/search` - Search DOJ documents by keyword (POST with JSON body: `{query, locale}`)
- `/api/summarize` - Generate AI summary from search results (POST, Server-Sent Events stream)
- `/api/deep-analyze` - Fetch and analyze a specific PDF (POST, SSE stream)

## Document Types

The searchable archive includes:
- Court filings and indictments
- Victim impact statements and depositions
- Flight logs and travel records
- Financial records and correspondence
- Evidence exhibits and investigative documents

All documents are official Department of Justice releases.

## Technical Stack

- Frontend: Next.js 16 (App Router), React 19, TypeScript 5, Tailwind CSS 4
- AI: Groq SDK with Llama 3.3 70B
- Caching: Upstash Redis
- Worker: Express 5 + Playwright + pdf-parse (for PDF analysis)
- Database: Neon Postgres (consent logging only)
- Deployment: Vercel (app) + Render (worker)

## Contact & Contribution

- GitHub: https://github.com/epstein-search
- Issues: Report bugs or request features via GitHub Issues
- This project is open source and accepts contributions
